--- Kevin Bourrillion <kevinb@...> wrote:
> Yes. 
>     java junit.textui.TestRunner your.Class > filename
>  
> PS. If you were looking for a more specific answer... just ask a more
> specific question!  :-)

I'll ask the more specific question:
  I'm often expecting a complex text result for a test case.
  I would like these "right answers" stored in a text file,
  rather than in the source code of the junit test case.  I
  suspect that adding a new method of the form
  assertEquals(File expected, String result) 
  would be very useful.  Has anyone done this, or something like 
  this?  An even cooler way to do this (if possible) would
  be a method like assertEqualsFile(String result), where the
  method would determine the file name by concating the TestCase
  name and the test method name.  Any thoughts on this?

Also, it would be nice if the javadoc generated documentation
for junit where on line at the www.junit.org site.  (Or did I
just miss them?)

Joshua
